jx.jx_en_mean: have ascertained something from a reliable source

entry.def: The authorities are the people who have the power to make decisions and to make sure that laws are obeyed.

example.ex: This provided a pretext for the authorities to cancel the elections...
example.tran: 这给当局取消此次选举提供了借口。

example.ex: The prison authorities have been criticised for not moving more quickly to end the protest by inmates.
example.tran: 监狱当局因没有尽快采取行动制止犯人抗议而受到批评。

entry.def: An authority is an official organization or government department that has the power to make decisions.

example.ex: Any alterations had to meet the approval of the local planning authority.
example.tran: 任何改建都要取得当地规划机构的批准。

entry.def: Authority is the right to command and control other people.

example.ex: Local police chiefs should re-emerge as figures of authority and reassurance in their areas...
example.tran: 各地警察局局长应当重树其维护辖区安定的执法者形象。

example.ex: The judge had no authority to order a second trial.
example.tran: 法官无权进行二次审判。

entry.def: If someone has authority, they have a quality which makes other people take notice of what they say.

example.ex: He had no natural authority and no capacity for imposing his will on others.
example.tran: 他天生缺乏威信，根本没有能力把他的意志强加于人。

entry.def: Authority is official permission to do something.

example.ex: The prison governor has refused to let him go, saying he must first be given authority from his own superiors.
example.tran: 监狱长拒绝释放他，说他首先必须得到上级官员的许可。

entry.def: Someone who is an authority on a particular subject knows a lot about it.

example.ex: He's universally recognized as an authority on Russian affairs.
example.tran: 他是公认的俄罗斯事务专家。

entry.def: If you say you have it on good authority that something is true, you mean that you believe it is true because you trust the person who told you about it.

example.ex: I have it on good authority that there's no way this light can cause skin cancer.
example.tran: 我有来自权威人士的说法，这种光不可能引起皮肤癌。

means.word_mean: 1. the power or right to give orders or make decisions;

sentences.sentence: "he has the authority to issue warrants"
"deputies are given authorization to make arrests"

means.word_mean: 2. (usually plural) persons who exercise (administrative) control over others;
3. an expert whose views are taken as definitive;

sentences.sentence: "he is an authority on corporate law"

means.word_mean: 4. freedom from doubt; belief in yourself and your abilities;

sentences.sentence: "his assurance in his superiority did not make him popular"
"after that failure he lost his confidence"
"authority for the program was renewed several times"
"this book is the final authority on the life of Milton"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from Old French autorite, from Latin auctoritas, from auctor 'originator, promoter' (see author)

sentences.cn: 秋天,当权者自?6776授权我买高机动性的汽车.
sentences.en: In the au _ mn the authorities automatically authorize me to buy highly mobile augtomobiles.

sentences.cn: 并且当当权者结束这一惯例, 学生的反映是激烈的.
sentences.en: And when the authorities put an end to the practice, students reacted harshly.

sentences.cn: 他经过深思熟虑,对那个日渐堕落的代表团进行了谴责,这表明了他对那些当权者的蔑视.
sentences.en: His deliberate denouncement of the degenerating delegation denotes his defiance of the authority.

sentences.cn: 当肯尼斯知道当权者不容许他做选择时,他就造反了.
sentences.en: Mr. Kenneth rebelled when he was told that the authorities permitted him no choice.

sentences.cn: 通货膨胀是上一年来中国当权者持续头痛的事情.
sentences.en: Inflation has been a consistent headache for Chinese authorities over the last year.

sentences.cn: 这种恩赐只要当权者心血来潮随时可以取消.
sentences.en: It was a privilege revokable at any time on whim of the authorities.

sentences.cn: 律是当权者与大众之间进行交流的一种运作方式.
sentences.en: Law is an exercise in communication between authority and the public.

sentences.cn: 秋天,当权者自动授权我买高机动性的汽车.
sentences.en: In the autumn the authorities automatically authorize me to buy highly mobile automobiles.

sentences.cn: 坦尼森写道: 当权者 忘记了死去的国王.
sentences.en: Tennyson wrote: " Authority forgets a dying king. "

sentences.cn: 真正的当权者是这个城镇.
sentences.en: Authority is in the town.

sentences.cn: 一切当权者都应该受到质询.
sentences.en: All authority should be questioned.

sentences.cn: 他在被告知当权者没有给他机会的时候造反.
sentences.en: He rebelled when he was told that the authorities permitted him no choice.

sentences.cn: 这种恩赐只要当权者随时可以取消.
sentences.en: It was a privilege revocable at any time on whim of the authorities.

sentences.cn: 他们视他为敢于与苏联当权者抗争的伟大作家与英雄.
sentences.en: He was perceived as a great writer and hero who had defied the Russian authorities.

Sentence.sentence: His solution was to learn something from the rebels it was fighting: decentralising authority to self-organising teams.
Decentralisation of authority was also found to be more effective in military operations.
Nicaraguan naval authorities had banned sea travel in the area because of bad weather and strong winds, but the tour boat proceeded anyway.
Blandon, the boat’s owner, has been arrested by Nicaraguan authorities, the state-run news agency said.
Much of the criticism is directed at the British Airports Authority, which runs seven major airports, including the three main ones serving in London.
The same year, the Federal Aviation Authority required that the boxes, which were never actually black, be painted orange or yellow to aid visibility.
Why did the Federal Aviation Authority require the black boxes be painted orange or yellow
Each critic in those examples is charging, in a different way, that someone in authority is intentionally being incurious.

Sentence.sentence: The British airports Authority, recently bought by a Spanish company, says the root cause of the problem is not the ownership structure, but a lack of runway and terminal capacity, which it's addressing through a programme of heavy investment.

Sentence.sentence: The Competition Commission is now to investigate whether the British airports Authority needs to sell off some of its assets.
